name: LLMNR Spoofer
author: Robin Francois <rof@navixia.com>
description:
LLMNR (Link-local Multicast Name Resolution) is the successor of NetBIOS (Windows Vista and up) and is used to
          resolve the names of neighboring computers. This module forges LLMNR responses by listening for LLMNR requests
          sent to the LLMNR multicast address (224.0.0.252) and responding with a user-defined spoofed IP address.

options.name: WORKSPACE
options.description: Specify the workspace for this module

options.name: TIMEOUT
options.description: The number of seconds to wait for new data

options.name: GATEWAY_PROBE_HOST
options.description: Send a TTL=1 random UDP datagram to this host to discover the default gateway's MAC

options.name: GATEWAY_PROBE_PORT
options.description: The port on GATEWAY_PROBE_HOST to send a random UDP probe to (random if 0 or unset)

options.name: SPOOFIP
options.description: IP address with which to poison responses

options.name: REGEX
options.description: Regex applied to the LLMNR Name to determine if spoofed reply is sent

options.name: TTL
options.description: Time To Live for the spoofed response
